Choices:  A: countryside B: united states C: beach D: atlas E: developed land<n>Output:		 the highway was named rural highway A<n>The highway was named national highway B<n>All the land in the united states is developed land<n>There are 7,777 inhabited islands in the world<n>The highway is rural highway B<n>The highway was named wilderness highway A<n>The highway is national highway C<n>The highway is rural road A<n>When asked to describe the people in the United States, the people are:<n>People:<n>Americans:<n>Americans:<n>People:<n>People:<n><n>Input: You have your cat. You take him to the vet for the annual check-up. After the vet checks him out, you bring him home while it’s still warm outside. You decide to let him sleep on your bed. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Output: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>So the final answer is 12<n><n>Input:You are seeking to provide yourself what when you're applying for a job? Choices:  A: work B: employment C: income D: hope E: offer<n>Output:		 C - income  D - income  E - employment<n><n>Subnetting is a complex problem for which you need to find a way to compute the solutions using the smallest possible number of distinct subnets.<n>A good set for this problem is the set of all computers that share an IP address -- it covers about 97% of the all of the IPv4 addresses, which gives you a bit more flexibility in searching.<n>This particular problem is not as challenging as one could think, because most systems do not share IP addresses and subnets. Here are the best tools for your subnetting:<n><n>This is only a very loose approximation, but I thought it would be easy. As a basic rule of thumb, if you are considering using a hash function, use the same hashing function on all the input and output.<n><n>I wrote this code for a math class I took in 5th grade. I think I’m the first grader to do that, but I’m glad I did. What I found really interesting is that the algorithm ends up giving you numbers that you don’t need in the result. The only thing that makes sense to me is that this algorithm “trains” you well for other problems, but ends up doing the opposite once you have to solve the problem by yourself. Here’s the code: http://pastebin.com/qw5kW4N2<n><n>So I just want to see the code at a glance instead having to scroll through the source. Thanks!<n><n>You can change the name of the output string by editing the file on pastebin that contains that string. I usually give it<n>$%= "$%+"<n>and there you go. The reason for putting "%" there is that %+ is a special number sequence which appears often. You don’t want to use %+ except when you have to format text and want to preserve it.<n><n>How do you actually get the result if the string contains a space?<n><n>There's no way to retrieve the result from pastebin or file. Its just an index of all the current pastebin pages and an index of all the files (in this case). There's only one instance (in this case) of a space in there; the rest of it is just spaces. You're just getting the index of all the currently pastebin pages, and it happens to be one of "all".<n>\---<n>If you're getting

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Output: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>So the final answer is 12<n><n>Input:Where can you purchase food and eat it at tables? Choices:  A: house B: fast food restaurant C: library D: conference E: paper<n>Output:		 None of the above<n><n>Input:Which of the following is true about David and Lisa?<n>a: David is not always wearing a button down shirt. b: David hates wearing a collar. c: David does wear a collar. d: David does not wear a collar. e: David has no trouble with shirts. f: David wears collars all the time. g: David uses his collar frequently.<n>output: none of the above<n><n>Question: Can the distance between two points where they are facing each other in space increase by only a small amount as time passes? Why? Example: I have two points A and B in a straight line. Time is measured in seconds. The distance between a point and a second from it is the length of a straight line. It is increasing in distance as time passes. Therefore, the straight line cannot shorten by the distance traveled simply by time. If the two points are not straight and the distance between them can’t be increased then how does the distance increase?<n>Answer: The straight line cannot decrease simply by time. The distance between your two points is longer now than it ever has been. The straight line has not decreased because time has not taken a factor in increasing the distance between the two points. Therefore, I reject the hypothesis that this distance must decrease by the amount the time. The truth is that the length of the longest straight line is increasing as time passes but this increase in length is not a function of the change in time. Consequently, a straight line must not shorten as one passes the second point. To use a longer straight line to compare, I’d better choose first point A since it is higher in the straight line than second point B. But the second point is moving away from me and is further away than first A. Therefore the second point cannot decrease as time passes. I still have the third point A for comparison since we used a longer straight line to start with. However the third point is moving away from second A and is closer than the first A. Therefore the third point cannot decrease as time progresses.<n><n>Input:Which year did Paul become a Christian? Give the answer for all the years listed.<n>Output: Paul had never been born the year before he became a Christian. I believe Paul was born in a pagan family. His family lived in Babylon. His parents and siblings were pagans. I believe that the Christians had never been converted to Christianity until Paul came to the world. The Christians accepted Jesus in the year

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Output: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>So the final answer is 12<n><n>Input:Where would there be a connection to go to another place? Choices:  A: wires B: electrical circuit C: computer network D: wall E: freeway<n>Output:		<n>1) A wire connects a building to another building. 2) An electrical circuit goes from one building to another. 3) A highway connects to every building, not every street to every building. 4) A freeway has lights that make vehicles able to go a distance. 5) A bridge connects two cities, not two provinces.<n>Solution: 1) You can reach place b by wire because (A) is true and (B) is the only possible answer.<n>2) B is the shortest path between two places and D and E are too complicated and not true.<n>3) There is connection to the outside world, but it requires to connect to the inside world by electrical wire.<n>4) D is the shortest path between C and A.<n>5) E is too complicated and true is not the only possibility.<n>Solution: A) is true.<n>6) A is true.

The order of preference would be January to February (A to B), January to D (B to C) and A to E (C to D). The order of preference in the order above would be (January) to (February), and A to D (C to E).

Shopping center<n>from Wikipedia: A clothing store<n>From Wikipedia The washing machine is a machine that uses electricity to wash or dry clothes. It uses a drum and a detergent to make clothes dry quickly. The detergent is usually ammonia, which is an alkali solution. After clothes have been in the washing machine, the detergent has been activated, and the detergent will dissolve if it is in contact with water. From Wikipedia: The clothing store is a store that sells clothes. From Wikipedia: The Laundromat is a place where clothes are cleaned, dried, and changed. The term laundry is from the verb 'Laundry', meaning to wash, and'mat' being the verb 'to clean'. It generally does not need to be done on a daily basis, although the term is sometimes widely used to refer to a large laundry that can be very large.<n>From Wikipedia: The laundry room contains a number of different machines to remove and reuse laundry. From Wikipedia: A shoe store is a store that will sell shoes. From Wikipedia: A clothing store is a store which sells clothes. From Wikipedia : a store selling clothes A=D, E=P, N=R, Q=S, S=T, U=V, V=W, W=Y, Z=Z, (x)/(x+x)=1, (y)/(y+z)=0
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Output: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>So the final answer is 12<n><n>Input:Where would people be looking at some things which can move, but are not moving? Choices:  A: football stadium B: surface of earth C: car show D: opera E: movie<n>Output:		 The field is moving around us and the movie is not. So the original answer is C<n><n>Input:What is the value of a gram of rock?<n>Output: $5<n>Because there is no weight in a gram of rock, therefore there is no limit of $5 dollars. Rock is made of $5 dollars since every rock is the smallest amount of a bill $5 in the pocket.<n>Input: If they throw the rock into the ocean, they will only get $5 dollars back from it.<n>Output: If they take the rock out of the ocean, they will get $5 dollars back.<n>There is $5000 in the ocean. If they cut $5 off each end, they will get 50 more dollars.<n>Input:If they took the rock out of the sea, they will only get 50 dollars back.<n>Output: If you take a $5 dollar coin out of the ocean and then put it into the same coin jar, you will have $10 dollars.<n>Input: If the rock is taken out of the beach, you will only get $2 back.<n>Output: You will get $2 only if the rock is in the ocean. If you keep the rock in beach for a day, it will be $6 by the time the day is over.<n>Input:A rock can sink into the ocean floor. If you put the rock in the ocean, you will not get anything back.<n>Output: They will also be nothing at all if they throw the rock into ocean floor.<n><n> Input:What is the difference between an acre, a acre and a mile?<n>Output: The size of a mile is an average mile. That means that an acre is an area of 800 square feet. An acre is an area of 8000 square feet. Therefore, a 1.5 acre area is about half of a mile for a car drive. If you have a 2 acre area to drive, it takes about two and a half hours to drive an average distance. For that length of time we would need to drive a normal size car with a normal size engine.<n>Input:What is a cubic yard?<n>Output: One cubic yard equals 150 gallons. If you have 10 gallons filled, a cubic yard is 60 gallons. We would need 10 gallons to get a cubic yard.<n>Output:The same thing applies to horse. If you have a horse, fill it up with water. When you put your horse in water, you will get 50 more gallons of water

The relative, correctly answered your question.<n>Output:If a relative asked “What will half five-senths be?” and you answered, “One half of one quarter five-sevenths of one eighth of nine eighths of one octave of tenths of decants of one tenth of a pentave of twelveths of decants of twenty-sixths of decants of thirty-sixths of decths of…” the relative answered the correct question.
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Output: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>So the final answer is 12<n><n>Input:Utensils are used during what evening activity? If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Output: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>So the final answer is 12<n><n>Input:What would a person do if he or she just woke up? Choices:  A: drink tea B: thank god C: open eyes D: feel angry E: complete sentence<n>Output:		 nothing because my brain doesn’t work that way.<n>How is it that we can wake up? If you think about it, the body has to start working for you to wake up. It has to process what it smells, feels, tastes and sees. This makes it so that once your brain does not have enough signals, nothing happens. The only way your brain wakes up is if there is a signal from outside the body. In order to receive information from the body, you need an antenna or sensory organ. These parts, which look like hair and skin cells, are called sensory organs.<n>There are very specific parts of the body that will tell your brain about what happened. However, you only will get the information if your brain recognizes those areas. When the brain recognizes certain areas, it will start the process of sending signals. This will trigger the neurons in the brain. Once this process is completed, the brain should stop sending signals.<n>In order for the brain to wake up, it must send a signal to all the parts. The only different part that can get a message is the olfactory system. The olfactory system is a part that is in contact with almost everything that smells. The olfactory organ, which is the nose, smells. To process this information, your olfactory nerve sends signals to your brain. The result from the signal is when your brain creates the electrical signals. If there is a signal from the nose, brain will stop sending any electrical signals. Since the brain stopped sending electrical signals, the nerves will die off. This process is called an electrochemical shutdown.<n>The olfactory system is one of the first nerve systems that wakes up. If there is an electrical signal sent by the nose, the olfactory nerve will immediately pick up on it and start sending a message. This process also triggers an electrical response from your brain. This electrical response is when your brain creates an electrical signal, which results in the brain creating a neuron. This is how the brain gets more signals.<n>Before this electrical signal happens, there will be chemical reactions. The chemicals in the olfactory system trigger an electrical response. The electrical response will start the nerve cell activity. Some nerves have more activity than others, and when the nerve cells have more activity, there will be more electrical signals from the olfactory system and from your brain. These electrical signals will activate more neurons, and this is how they wakeup.<n>The process of waking up happens when your brain

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Output: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>So the final answer is 12<n><n>Input:I wanted  a side chair for people to visit me while I worked, where did I have it put? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Output: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>So the final answer is 12<n><n>Input:What is the opposite of a village? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Output: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>So the final answer is 12<n><n>Input:What does a judge do when someone is convicted of a crime? Choices:  A: conduct trial B: arrest C: bring in verdict D: pass sentence E: serve justice<n>Output:		 Conviction means the person was found guilty, which means they must return to court, where they will serve the sentence, which can be up to 5 years<n>Arrest means the police came to the person's house, where they would likely have been found, or where they could simply be located by people who know where the person lives<n>Pass sentence means the person may be released after serving the sentence. This could be done by an informal agreement between the parties or by a formal order from a judge. The judge could also do an informal release.<n><n>Input: What does a judge do when a person is convicted of a crime and given a mandatory sentence?<n>Output: Not only was the individual sentenced, but he must serve the sentence and will likely get released when his time is over.<n><n>Input: Where does a judge find a judge in the federal and state courts?<n>Output: All courtrooms have an attorney general's office located on the first floor that has a clerk/correspondence office, a clerk's residence, a visitor's desk, and a guest's lounge.<n><n>Input: Which is the only way for a judge to become a circuit judge?<n>Output: Judges who have been certified by the state of Kentucky may be admitted to the court once they have served for three years on the bench. After they graduate from law school, though, they may still be a circuit judge.<n><n>Input: How much time do judges spend at a trial?<n>Output: The judge spends most of his time preparing the jury. After the jury decides whether to recommend a death penalty or a lesser penalty, the judge has a month to make his recommendation. If that recommendation is not approved, the judge has another month to do so and another month to actually sentence the person convicted. Once the judge approves the death penalty recommendation and sentence, he has two weeks to make the formal recommendation of the sentence.<n><n>Input: When does a death sentence for a capital crime begin?<n>Output: The law states that a death sentence must begin when the death warrant has been issued. The court issues the death warrant and the victim is notified about the crime and the defendant must answer charges in court to begin the process.<n><n>Input: Who makes a death sentence? (Choose all that apply) A: district attorney B: public defender C: attorney general D: judge E: county clerk<n>Output: A is responsible for the death sentence, and no one else. B is responsible for a death sentence from Kentucky court,

A wine press will produce about 30 millilitres of juice. The other answer is grape juice from the kitchen.

If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He spins Juliette’s foot and then kicks her right foot. He spins Tybalt‘s foot and then kicks it. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Output: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>So the final answer is 12<n><n>Input:Why would I want to be exercising? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Output: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>So the final answer is 12<n><n>Input:The doctor recommended washing hands, what was being promoted? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Output: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>So the final answer is 12<n><n>Input:Where is one likely to purchase listening vinyl? If a passenger were to want to sit on his own or in a window seat, they would not be able to do so because there would be some turbulence, and passengers would not be able to keep their feet on the seat. There is a safety feature in the airplane that will slow the aircraft down by slowing down cabin air pressure. If the passenger wanted more room than the cabin air pressure would provide, they would be able to put their feet on the seat, which would help them. It is the cabin air pressure that slows the airplane down. The cabin air pressure of an airplane should be between 3 and 4 inches per cubic foot.<n><n>Input: A group of students were given $100 to buy something for themselves. Choices:  Wind B: solar C: meteor<n>Output: An eclipse happens when the angle of light rays from the sun is less than 90 degrees. As the angle of light rays decreases, light rays are reflected from the surface of the sun and refracted by the Earth’s atmosphere. When the solar atmosphere is at or a little over 90 degrees, the planet’s light rays are not reflected and light rays strike directly at the Earth, causing the eclipse.<n><n>Input:What do you see on the surface of Mercury? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Output: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>So the final answer is 12<n><n>Input:Collections of atoms called molecules make up everything you can hold in your what? Choices:  A: atom B: anything C: air D: feet E: hands<n>Output:		 An atom is a collection of atoms. They have exactly one atom each or none at all.<n>An atom should be considered a compound. It’s not a monolith. They are not all the same length! The longer the atoms are, the heavier and slower they move.<n>An atom is usually a single piece that contains other pieces. Often, one piece is in the center and you can use different pieces to construct larger pieces.<n>An atom is a single atom. It has a nucleus and is made of the same atoms. That’s why atoms are not made of “chunks.” An atom’s molecules have exactly one of each and are not made of any other atoms. Inorganic molecules are made of only one kind of atom, usually carbon.<n>An atom is made of atoms that are equal in mass and have the same number of atoms. That means each atom is equal to exactly one atom in other atoms.<n><n>Input: An atom contains just one electron. How many is that? Output: One is not exactly one.<n>Each electron has two “positions.” It either has an electron or a hole. A hole is a place where an electron cannot be. But it also cannot fill the hole. It is a vacuum.<n>Each electron has four other electrons. They can also be called electron ions.<n>The total number of electrons in an atom is.001*(anatomic mass – electron mass) = 1/(anatomic mass–electron mass). This is called its chemical mass.<n>The total number from this is 1/(anatomic mass – atomic mass). This is called the “structure” of the atom.<n><n>Input:A single electron can have two different roles. How many can that electron have? Output: Each of these roles must be filled. This would mean that the electron can occupy no more than one of the four possibilities given. If the electron can not occupy the role of any of its four possibilities, it will be a vacancy. If the electron can occupy only one of these four positions, it will be a double electron. That is an atom.<n>Input: The number of electrons in an atomic atomic mass is.005. What is the mass of a single atom?<n>Output: An atom has exactly one atom at any moment. You will never see an atom composed of more than one atom. The one atom is always the same. They all have the same atomic mass.<n><n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Output: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>So the final answer is 12<n><n>Input:He finally found someone as ugly as him, knowing he wouldn't be the one sticking out was what? Choices:  A: gorgeous B: handsome C: pleasing D: glorious E: pretty beautiful<n>Output:		 ugly is cute<n>ugly is unattractive is adorable is funny<n>ugly is ugly is nice is nice is the most beautiful<n>ugly is beautiful is nice is the most handsome<n>ugly is beautiful, isn't pretty, isn't attractive, isn't being cute, isn't being attractive<n>ugly, ugly is handsome is handsome, isn't being cute is handsome<n>ugly, ugly, cute, handsome is handsome<n>ugly is ugly, ugly, handsome is handsome<n><n>Input: He goes to the fair because he wants to eat the corn kernels<n>Output: He eats one corn kernel<n>At the fair, he tried to eat more. However, he got tired because of his huge stomach. He went home and put all the pieces of corn kernels back in the bag. How many pieces did he put back in?<n>Output:He left out the pieces because he didn’t want them to go to waste.<n><n>Input: When the girl who liked him was sitting home, she was reading. He was sitting waiting to hear the sound of her door open. She was reading for 40 minutes and got very close to finishing it. She decided to stop because she found somebody very desirable. The book was about 50% done. She could also finish it quickly because she was very good at reading. He noticed her reading and didn’t care because he had some problems and he really wanted someone to talk to. She finished the book. He could tell by the fact that she was crying. Did he get close to finishing the book?<n>Output: He wanted to talk to her for a long time so that he could tell her everything that was wrong with him and that he really didn't like girls much. He decided to just tell her.<n><n>Input: He was on the train train looking out at the clouds. He felt sorry when he couldn't see the clouds. He could see just one blue cloud. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Output: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>So the final answer is 12<n><n>Input:During the brainstorming session there was a lot of talking and what? Choices:  A: obtaining information B: exchange of ideas C: sharing information D: conversation E: gathhering of information<n>Output:		<n>The brainstorming session resulted in the following questions: 1) Who were the team members in the brainstorming session? 2) Why is it important to take notes? 3) What did they decide to do?<n>Output:<n>They brainstormed questions and answered questions: 1) What is the purpose of brainstorming? 2) What is the purpose to take notes? 3. Who were the other team members and why is it important to take note? 4. Why is it important to be focused?<n>Output: 1) To brainstorm questions that other members have not brainstormed,2) To brainstorm what to do,3) To brainstorm the ideas which might be related to each other4) To brainstorm the ways that team members can discuss ideas.<n>Output: The team leaders decided to take notes and answer questions: 1) To brainstorm ideas 2) To take notes 3) And to brainstorm to take note.

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Output: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>So the final answer is 12<n><n>Input:Where can you see a mammoth in NYC? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads.
